## Survey data {.smaller}

::::: {.columns}

:::: {.column width="68%"}
2017-18 **National Health Survey**

::: {.incremental}
- Conducted by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS)
- Sample size <span class="blB">17,248</span> persons 15 years and older
- <span class="blR">1,694 (76%)</span> of SA2s had survey data
- Median SA2 sample size: <span class="blR">8</span>
:::

## Auxiliary data {.smaller}

::::: {.columns}

:::: {.column width="68%"}
::: {.incremental}
- 2016 Australian **census** data â€” collapsed to six principal components for analysis [@RN618]
- Average Estimated Resident **Population** between 2017 and 2018
- Index of Relative **Socio-Economic Disadvantage** (IRSD) from Socio-Economic Indexes for Areas by the ABS [@RN560]
- **Remoteness** (ARIA+) [@RN348]
	- Classed as major cities, inner regional and outer regional to very remote
- **Social Health Atlas of Australia** estimates [@RN113] at Primary Health Network (n = 31) and Population Health Area level (n = 1165)

## Models

::: {.incremental}
- <span class="blB">Single TSLN</span> specification for <span class="blB">all</span> risk factors
- Model selection was conducted using a variety of *frequentist* and *Bayesian* metrics
	- **New** variable selection tools for two-stage approaches
:::
